channel.title: Xml
channel.description:
Alright, would it be better or worse to replace most instances where you would use enums, with XML parsing to enums?
Example if you don't get what I mean: Potions, and all the data they hold. Would it better to load all the constant info for them in an enum, or load them from XML into a collection?
Note: All XML loading will be done in the background on server startup.

item.title: Xml
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I don’t like using outside libraries but this is pretty cool looking.

Read full topic

item.title: Xml
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

should be using JSON or something other than XML

Read full topic

item.title: Xml
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

zyle1992:

Depends. XML has more overhead compared to using an enum, and takes up more space on the drive. Parsing it can also be a hassle if you’re not familiar with it. It is much easier to edit “humanly”, and can be reloaded any time, instead of having to stop the program, recompile, and start again.

Parsing it is the easy part, as long as you use a native library, and thanks for the input.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

I am using xml for warps and npc
